definitions.definition: different from a particular person or thing

examples.text: Music is quite unlike any other art form.
The sound was **not unlike** that of birds singing.

definitions.definition: used to contrast somebody/something with another person or thing

examples.text: Unlike most systems, this one is very easy to install.
It's very unlike him to be so late.

wordOrigin: Middle English: perhaps originally an alteration of Old Norse úlíkr; compare with Old English ungelīc ‘not of the same kind, not comparable’.
